meanings.definition: The action of closing something, especially a window or door, with shutters.
meanings.sent1: She quickly completed the shuttering of the windows before the storm.
meanings.sent2: He secured the house by shuttering all the doors tightly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat enjoyed playing with the shuttering of the old shutters.
meanings.sent4: The darkness outside was like a thick shuttering, blocking out any light.
meanings.sent5: The loud bang of the shuttering echoed through the empty house.

meanings.definition: The material used to construct formwork for concrete.
meanings.sent1: The workers brought in the heavy shuttering to start building the formwork.
meanings.sent2: The quality of the shuttering greatly affects the strength of the concrete structure.
meanings.sent3: The playful children pretended the shuttering was a giant castle wall.
meanings.sent4: The wooden shuttering embraced the wet concrete like a protective shield.
meanings.sent5: The smooth surface of the shuttering ensured a flawless finish to the concrete.
